intro: Mimulus tilingii, commonly known as the yellow monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Phrymaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and moist meadows. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Mimulus tilingii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
